content.description: Sit start at the bottom of the cave Â with a left hand under cling at lip of the cave and a right side pull. Hit a square jug and move left to a side pull crimp. Crux revolves around hitting a slope before the lip. Easy top out. Gravity Storm shares the same start and first few moves.
content.protection: Creative landing. Stuff two pads between boulders to fill the hole. Lay two pads on top and the landing. Have 1 more pad to pad the left boulder for "On the Rocks V6" or the right boulder on "Gravity Storm V5"
content.location: This side of the Bar Stool is best approached from the Pohogwe trail loop on the side looking the river. Ahead up hill to find this side.

content.description: Sit start at the bottom of the cave with a left hand under cling at lip of the cave and a right side pull. Hit a square jug and move right to a sloper to a jug. easy top out. Easy top out.
content.protection: Creative landing. Stuff two pads between boulders to fill the hole. Lay two pads on top and the landing. Have 1 more pad to pad the left boulder for "On the Rocks V6" or the right boulder on "Gravity Storm V5"
content.location: Approach from the visitor's center on the Pohogwe Trail loop, refer map and walk up hill from the river side.

content.description:
Short problem on an adjacent boulder from the bar stool. This problem can be seen lookers left of Beer Goggles.

Start low and left in a good mail slot. Using intermediate slopers, to gain the pocket. Easy mantle.

Down climb as for Beer Goggles
Stand start with left hand flat edge and right hand crimp on face around chest height. Work your way onto the upper slab with balancy moves on good rock. A harder sit start could be added.
